results.title: Ten step discipline program
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Help for parents”
Ten step discipline program: Steps 1 to 3 helps teachers use Reality Therapy on themselves. Steps 4 to 6 provide teachers with a simple but effective approach. Steps 7 to 10 consider what procedures can be followed if students refuse to change their behaviour.

results.title: Reality therapy and discipline at home
results.creator_credit: Institute of Reality Therapy, Educator Training Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Help for parents”.
Designed to provide ideas for developing parenting skills to help young people evaluate their behaviour and to plan more acceptable alternatives. Dr William Glasser interviews Tom McGuiness presenting the basic practices used in the Parent Involvement Program at the Institute of Reality Therapy, Educator Training Centre in Los Angeles. Demonstrates how each step is applied in the parent-child relationship.

results.title: Helping hand
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Heart of the matter”.
Explains how current EEC policy of dumping surpluss food on Third World Countries simply encourages governments to do nothing about their own problems and that cash aid is preferable as it can be used to directly improve the infrastructure. Also the logistics involved in the distribution of EEC surplus in Ethiopia.

results.title: Remembering
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This series documents the historical and cultural traditions of China, showing how attitudes in China today are shaped not only by the doctrines of Marx and Mao but also by ancient beliefs and traditions and by the living memories of recent cataclysmic events. This program seeks to identify what it is that unifies a quarter of the world’s population. Uses both original footage and archive material to give a broad overview of historic and modern China.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mischa Scorer, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton

results.title: Living
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
Over four fifths of China’s 1000 million inhabitants are peasants. This program visits a rural village to discover how they live. We follow the day to day life of a village family and focuses on the local Party secretary to depict the organisation of the village as a whole and the brigade and commune of which it is a part.

results.title: Trading
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program is Part Twelve of a twelve episode documentary, The Heart of the Dragon. The documentary records what is actually happening in China today and it captures on film the lives of peasants, factory workers, Party officials, artists, scientists, and even millionaires.

results.title: Creating
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program looks at the world of contemporary Chinese art, exploring the philosophic and historic influences that shape it. The way that Chinese artists pursue the essence of “reality” is examined as are the techniques which combine traditional values with unconventional materials to produce works that are resplendently Chinese.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
